text: [Music]
welcome to aws what's new
i'm jeff barr i've got three awesome
launches to share with you today
first up you can now use the new
graviton two processors with amazon rds
that search for relational database
service these instances give you up to
better performance and up to 52 better
price performance
this is of course all dependent on your
database engine and your workload
your results might vary our customers
are reporting great results so far
you can launch these instances using rds
for mysql
rds for postgresql and rds for mariadb
you get your choice of seven sizes up to
64 vcpus and your choice of either
m general purpose or r memory optimized
topping out at half a terabyte of memory
to learn more
read sebastian's blog post aws budget
actions are new
they're really cool and best of all
they'll help you to reduce any
unintentional spending in your aws
account so what's this all about
here's how it works you can now define
an action that you want to take when one
of your budgets exceeds its actual or
forecasted amount
the actions can target iem policies
service control policies for
organizations
or even specific ec2 rds instances
you could for example build a policy
that disallows the launch of fresh ec2
instances and apply to a user
a group or a role the actions can be run
automatically
or after manual approval you can set up
five budget thresholds up to 10 actions
for each threshold
to learn more read the what's new now
finally let's talk chocolate and peanut
butter
two of my favorite snacks in this case
lambda's the chocolate
private link is a peanut butter
wonderful on their own now even better
together
so as a quick reminder private link
gives you private connectivity between
your vpcs and aws services
you can now manage and invoke lambda
functions from within a vpc without
putting your traffic on the public
internet
you just create and use vpc endpoints
and then you absolutely can attach some
iem policies to control access to
it and to the lambda functions to learn
more just read the what's new
oh yeah before we wrap up let me mention
i choose items for this video from a
much much longer list
just this week i had 51 items to choose
from far too many for a video
you can always check out the aws what's
new page for a complete list
that's all for today and for 2020 from
here on out i'm going to focus on my

i'm going to be back right after that
between now and then
keep the emails tweets and messages
